comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Hernando Fitz-James Stuart, 14th Duke of Peñaranda de Duero (1882-1936) was a Spanish nobleman with a strong interest in polo; he and his brother played on Spain's polo team in the 1920 Olympics. (They won silver medals.) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hernando_Fitz-James_Stuart,_14th_Du... Ivor Churchill Guest, 1st Viscount Wimborne (1873-1939), was Lord Lieutenant of Ireland, first cousin to Winston Churchill: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivor_Guest,_1st_Viscount_Wimborne

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca:

Thank you for the much more complete names for these two gentlemen. We will expand the description when we update this record.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content:
Since Lord Wimborne arrived on June 1, 1914 this must be a ship taking them and the horses to Long Island for the International Polo Cup.
